definition: to return a courtesy/return gift
to answer/to agree
reply/answer/return/respond/echo
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: So many people feel you can be reading the book salute to know quite a lot of grace.
sentences.chinese: 所以多读书可以让人感觉你知书答礼，颇有风度。

sentences.english: "hope i see you well, sir, " returned the gentleman .
sentences.chinese: “希望你健康，先生，”那位绅士答礼。

definition: to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to salute/to make one's salutations
to bow with hands held in front
to salute/to greet
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
to accept a gift/to acknowledge greetings
to pay a return visit
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to bow respectfully with clasped hands/to beg humbly
old-fashioned women's obeisance/Taiwan pr. [lian4 ren4]
to nod and smile
to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
variant of 斂衽|敛衽[lian3 ren4]
to express gratitude/to thank
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
